column4: quick question if anyone is around to help .  using regexp to bulk rename files and hitting a wall.  what is the "any number of characters" combination?  [.]* ?  for example, I used the regexp to insert a hyphen befre and after the sections I want removed, thinking it would be easy to then remove everything between them using something like 's/-.{*}-//'  but not so much... I'm screwiong up the .* portion, I'm sure of it...
.* works in vi, that's why I asked.
give me an example string so I can try.
no, if you escape the period then it's actually a period and not a "any char" character. I thought you were replacing periods at first, thats why I suggested escaping.
yeah s/-.*-// works in vi. I don't know what the batch rename thing is doing for you.
are you writing your script or using some batch renaming app?
huh... I didn't know that command. Let me see it.
the regex-fu is not strong in me either.
I know using 2 regex and two for loops is not efficient, but does it work for you?
tab autocompletes nicks... if you call me roackaway my client doesn't highlight what you say to me.
keep in mind that everyone uses different implementations of regex. Python's regex aren't exactly the same as perl regex, for instance.
I use Konversation, because I'm in KDE. Maybe you could try X-Chat.
Perl's is the most widespread, I think.
